result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Timothy P. King

defendant.name: King, Timothy P.
defendant.address: N7641 Kingswan Rd., Black River Falls, WI 54615

records.addlTxt: DA pretrial offer form

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Satorius.  In 17CM22 defendant plead no contest to Count 8.  In 17CM79 defendant plead no contest to count 4.  In 17CM79 defendant plead no contest to count 3.  In 17CM108 defendant plead no contest to count 2 and count 1.  In 15CM203 defendant plead no contest to count 1 and count 4.  In 16CM177 defendant plead no contest to count count 2.  Based on those pleas this case was dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: The defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County Jail.

Covers 15CM203, 15CM234, 16CM119, 16CM177, 16CM190, 17CM5, 17CM22, 17CM23, 17CM79, 17CM108.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.   Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.    The defendant appeared by video from the Jackson County jail.  Attorney Satorius appeared in court.  Set for a plea in December.
cancel per SO a.m. sheet; custody JASO

Defense counsel SPD Travis Satorius appears.  Defendant is not present and Attorney Satorius states he has not had contact with thim.  Special Prosecutor William Nemer appears for the State.  State moves for warrants and the TR cases continue to track.  Court authorizes a bench warrant on all 10 criminal cases.
Status conference on September 22, 2017 at 09:45 am.
Satorius

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant did not appear.  Attorney Gardner appeared in court on 15CM203, 15CM234 and the 15TRs  only.  Attorney Gardner has no information as to where the defendant is.  The phone number is disconnected.  Correspondence has been unanswered.  State requested a warrant.   Warrant authorized on 17CM5, 17CM23, 17CM22, 17CM79 and 17CM108.  Body only.  Forfeit cash bonds.  Attorney Gardner requests to withdraw as counsel on the cases he represents him on.  Court granted the withdrawal.  Attorney Gardner will send the Judge an order.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Gardner.  Defendant does not want to enter plea today.  Set for jury trial.  Trials will not come off again, until there is a trial or plea held.  Set 15CM203 first.  1 day trial.  Track citations.

Covers 15CM234 and 15CM203.  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly reinstated in the State of Wisconsin.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
